means.word_mean: 1. inflammation of a diverticulum in the digestive tract (especially the colon); characterized by painful abdominal cramping and fever and constipation

auth_sentence.content: His doctor said it was a serious intestinal condition called diverticulitis and prescribed antibiotics.
auth_sentence.res_content: His doctor said it was a serious intestinal condition called diverticulitis and prescribed antibiotics.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His doctor said it was a serious intestinal condition called diverticulitis and prescribed antibiotics.

auth_sentence.content: But diverticulitis is often severe, and can need hospital treatment with antibiotics and fluids given through a drip.
auth_sentence.res_content: But diverticulitis is often severe, and can need hospital treatment with antibiotics and fluids given through a drip.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But diverticulitis is often severe, and can need hospital treatment with antibiotics and fluids given through a drip.

auth_sentence.content: Someone with diverticulitis may be treated at home with painkillers, antibiotics, laxatives and dietary advice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Someone with diverticulitis may be treated at home with painkillers, antibiotics, laxatives and dietary advice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Someone with diverticulitis may be treated at home with painkillers, antibiotics, laxatives and dietary advice.
